item.title: Customize your linux terminal with .bashrc
item.description: What is .bashrc .bashrc is a file that lies in your home directory. It executes on terminal bootup and refreshing. It is written in bash. You can use it to customize your terminal in different ways. Echo ascii text One of the simplest things you can do with .bashrc is to echo ascii text on bootup. For that you open .bashrc with your editor of choice, I’m using sudo vi ~/.
